title: Quarkus jacoco coverage not working in a multi module project where code and tests are in separate modules
body:
### Describe the bug

I have a quarkus microservice with 2 modules, `module-api` and `module-impl.` I have unit tests for both modules combined in `module-impl`. When I run `mvn verify`, then a jacoco report is generated, which only shows coverage for the code in `module-impl`, even though I have code from `modue-api` also covered by tests. I wanted the report to include correct coverage of all modules.

### Expected behavior

Quarkus jacoco should generate coverage of code in all project modules, even those which do not contain unit tests.

### Actual behavior

Quarkus jacoco only reports coverage for modules which contain unit tests. The code from other modules is reported as uncovered.

### How to Reproduce?

Example repo: https://github.com/JakubKubena/jacoco-coverage-demo

Branch: `quarkus-tests-in-impl-module`

run `mvn verify`
